intro: Allantoma impressa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Allantoma impressa is known for its ability to bloom year-round under optimal conditions.
